Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) unit, operating at 800-875 degrees C, is constructed with Ni-(Ce,Gd)O2-x (GDC) as the anode, yttria-stabilized zirconia as the electrolyte, and V2O5-added (LaSr)(CoFe)O-3-GDC as the cathode.
Titulo: Effect of voltage and temperature on NO removal with power generation in SOFC with V2O5-added LSCF-GDC cathode

Sentencas: Both the current-voltage measurement and the fixed-voltage test were performed on electrochemical NO reduction, i.e. DeNO(x) with power generation.
Titulo: Effect of voltage and temperature on NO removal with power generation in SOFC with V2O5-added LSCF-GDC cathode

Sentencas: As the voltage decreases, the NO conversion increases but only slightly.
Titulo: Effect of voltage and temperature on NO removal with power generation in SOFC with V2O5-added LSCF-GDC cathode

Sentencas: DeNO(x) by SOFC is operational with the O-2 concentration of 2-5% and temperature of 800-875 degrees C.
Titulo: Effect of voltage and temperature on NO removal with power generation in SOFC with V2O5-added LSCF-GDC cathode

Sentencas: The NO conversion increases with decreasing O-2 and NO concentrations but with increasing temperature.
Titulo: Effect of voltage and temperature on NO removal with power generation in SOFC with V2O5-added LSCF-GDC cathode

Sentencas: This process of DeNO(x) by SOFC should be suitable for NO removal from the exhaust of lean burn engines.
Titulo: Effect of voltage and temperature on NO removal with power generation in SOFC with V2O5-added LSCF-GDC cathode
